posts.post_content:
I like it. I wish I could find a way to abuse damaging myself, though. Oh wait, [Death's Shadow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death's Shadow).  
  
A cheap 2/2 always has applications in a mono red aggro, no matter how dumb it is.  
  
[Mogg Jailer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mogg Jailer), [Goblin Raider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Raider), etc.  
  
But now we have cards that aren't crippled by restrictive text;  
  
[Goblin Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Guide), [Goblin Wardriver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Wardriver), [Ember Hauler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ember Hauler), even [Bloodcrazed Goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodcrazed Goblin) (If you're not burning them, you're not winning anyway).
posts.html:
I like it. I wish I could find a way to abuse damaging myself, though. Oh wait, Death's Shadow.

A cheap 2/2 always has applications in a mono red aggro, no matter how dumb it is.

Mogg Jailer, Goblin Raider, etc.

But now we have cards that aren't crippled by restrictive text;

Goblin Guide, Goblin Wardriver, Ember Hauler, even Bloodcrazed Goblin (If you're not burning them, you're not winning anyway).

posts.post_content:
I don't see how this is not playable  
  
Red is the fastest colour when it comes to dealing damage, which is why this is and will never be close to a vanilla [Grizzly Bears](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grizzly Bears). Most red creatures that are 2/2 for 1R have drawbacks, and this has one of the 'not so serious'.   
  
Can be used as a backup plan to your burn in case its not enough, or to help finish your opponent
